story.text: (Adds data, background)BOGOTA Jan 2 (Reuters) - Colombian inflation was 0.23 percent in December, the government's National Statistics Department said on Tuesday, and full 2006 inflation fell comfortably within the target range of 4 percent to 5 percent. Consumer prices for the year rose 4.48 percent, the department said in a statement, compared with 4.85 percent in 2005. Colombian inflation was 0.07 percent in December 2005 and 0.24 percent in November of this year. Colombian consumer prices had been expected to rise 0.2 percent in December,according to the median forecast in a central bank poll of analysts last month. The bank raised its key interest rate 25 basis points to 7.5 percent in December to keep inflationary pressures in check.
story.title: update 1 - colombian dec cpi 0 . 23 pct vs 0 . 07 pct yr earlier
